metadata.title: CVE-2014-0092 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
lib/x509/verify.c in GnuTLS before 3.1.22 and 3.2.x before 3.2.12 does notproperly handle unspecified errors when verifying X.509 certificates fromSSL servers, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers viaa crafted certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.0.11+really2.12.23-12ubuntu2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2
libgnutls26 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2
No subscription required

guile-gnutls - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-xssl0 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2').
gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2').
gnutls28 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.11-2ubuntu1').
